alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 12:09PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Missouri, including the following counties, Lincoln, Saint Charles and Warren. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported numerous lingering road closures due to flooding. Rises continue to occur on some area creeks as well. Flooding is already occurring. Radar estimates and trained spotters indicate between 4 and 12 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Wentzville, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Lake St. Louis, Bridgeton, Dardenne Prairie, Troy, Warrenton, Weldon Spring, Wright City, Cottleville, St. Paul, Moscow Mills, Winfield, Davis, Truesdale and Hawk Point. - This includes the following State Parks... Cuivre River State Park and First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 188 and 229.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
